scripts.say: Hah. When it came down to it, those Sardegnian warships weren't worth a damn!
After all that talk about being the greatest fleet in the Mediterranean, in the end they couldn't even fight their way out of a wet paper bag.
Turns out it was a mistake to entrust the Mediterranean to them.
With their night carrier operations and improved shelling accuracy from their radars, the Royal Navy's victory was practically guaranteed.
The observation data has already been forwarded to the research and development department. They should prove invaluable in the development of new weapons.
And in the end that's all those insufferably arrogant Sardegnians were worth... Ahahaha!
Furthermore, Bismarck has finally begun to stir.
When she returns once more, all the lands and seas will soon belong to us.
Those who betray the Iron Blood shall quickly find that we are their judge, jury, and executioner.
Gneisenau, can I trust you to monitor the Sardegna Empire?
I want eyes on their fleet around the clock. Report any signs of treachery immediately.
